ground_truth_answer: Rhubarb and lavender have different maintenance requirements and therapeutic applications. Rhubarb is a rugged perennial that needs periodic maintenance - including fall cleanup and division every 10 years - to maintain proper growth and color. While primarily used for culinary purposes, its growth is affected by soil pH (6.0-6.8). Lavender, conversely, has extensive therapeutic applications - it's used for treating insomnia, anxiety, depression, and mood disturbances. Lavender can be used in various forms: as tea (1-2 tsp whole herb per cup), tincture (20-40 drops three times daily), or aromatherapy oil. While both plants require full sun, lavender specifically flourishes in sunny, stony habitats and can be processed into essential oils for medicinal use.
